meanings.definition: To convert into an azote or nitrogen compound.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was azotizing the soil to improve its fertility.
meanings.sent2: The farmer was azotizing the plants to help them grow better.
meanings.sent3: The gardener accidentally started azotizing the wrong patch of land, creating a nitrogen-rich surprise.
meanings.sent4: The process of azotizing the solution transformed it into a powerful fertilizer.
meanings.sent5: By azotizing the compost, the gardener was able to enrich the soil for the upcoming planting season.

meanings.definition: To treat or combine with nitrogen.
meanings.sent1: The chef was azotizing the meat to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent2: The manufacturer was azotizing the metal to make it more durable.
meanings.sent3: The students found a creative way to azotize their science project, impressing their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The artist was azotizing the paint to create a unique texture on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: By azotizing the fabric, the designer was able to give it a vibrant color that stood out on the runway.
